Book it Now Get to Know Us We've Been Around For Awhile! As we’ve been fortunate enough to expand our Five Bucks Drinkery family, our third location at 7498 Seminole Blvd. opened its doors to Seminole residents in February of 2024.  Our third location offers seating out on our gorgeous wraparound patio or stay out of the Florida heat indoors! Keeping true with Seminole this location is your go-to for a laid-back lunch with a view! This location features an expansive food menu, live music, and over 75 big screen tv’s perfect for any of our sporting event watch parties. We’ve got what you’re looking for! Get Social With Us #FindMeAtFiveBucks Facebook Instagram X-twitter Google Tripadvisor Yelp We are proud to say Five Bucks Drinkery has become a Downtown St Pete staple for over 10 years and counting. Through our big a$$ drinks, tasty food, and an atmosphere that can go from laid-back to bachelor party, its become the hang out for both locals and tourists! So whether you’re a Floridian or just flew in, we here at Five Bucks Drinkery would like to welcome you to hang out with us! And remember, what happens in Florida.. Stays in Florida!! Five Bucks Drinkery owner commits to additional COVID-19 safety measures Watch Now Menu Local National Weather Sports Traffic Watch Now Watch Now Close × Live Watch Alerts Search site Go Tampa Bay 28 Gives Tampa Bay 28 Listens Video Latest Video Watch Tampa Bay 28+ Tampa Bay 28 Weather 24/7 Full Circle Florida News Local News I-Team Investigations Price of Paradise Florida News National News News Links In Your Community Full Circle Florida Anchors Report Your Voice I-Team Investigations Patient No More Weather Tampa Bay 28 Weather 24/7 Radar Severe Weather Alerts Daily Forecast Hourly Forecast Maps & Forecasts Tracking the Tropics Tracking the Tropics Traffic Sports Lightning Rays Buccaneers USF The Spot - Tampa Bay 66 Lifestyle Things To Do At Home with Shay Mental Health Tampa Bay's Morning Blend Tampa Bay's Operation Honoring Heroes Florida Lottery Marketplace Don't Waste Your Money Your Health Matters WFTS Tampa Bay's Home Pros Real Estate Essentials Best of BayCare About Us What's on TV Meet the Tampa Bay 28 Team Contact Apps WFTS Sweepstakes The Spot - Tampa Bay 66 Fresh Start Advertise with Us Support Jobs at WFTS Sign In Newsletters Sign Out Manage Emails Apps Careers Search tampabaynews tampabay_28 tampabay28 UCK0UUsCjtMRNtS3BPh1Yc4w @tampabay_28 1 WX Alerts 1 Closings/Delays News Hillsborough Pinellas Polk Pasco Manatee Sarasota Hernando Citrus DeSoto Highlands Hardee More + Quick Links + News Hillsborough Pinellas Polk Pasco Manatee Sarasota Hernando Citrus DeSoto Highlands Hardee News Pinellas County Actions Facebook Tweet Email Lawsuit against St. Pete bar/restaurant dropped as owner outlines new COVID-19 safety protocols Prev Next The changes come after St. Pete filed a lawsuit against them for not following the city’s COVID-19 ordinance. By: Heather Leigh Posted and last updated ST. PETERSBURG, Fla — It’s a popular spot in the heart of Downtown St. Petersburg. “I’ve been doing this for 10 years, I love this place, I love the city, I love everything about this,” said Joshua Connell, owner of Five Bucks Drinkery. It’s why he plans to change things up by outlining new COVID-19 safety protocols to keep employees and customers safe. “We are going to be significantly more forceful about customers sitting to be served,” he said. “We’re not going to allow people to simply get up and walk around the restaurant anymore.” The changes come after St. Pete filed a lawsuit against them for not following the city’s COVID-19 ordinance. That litigation was ultimately dissolved late Thursday afternoon after it was provided the restaurant’s “Risk Mitigation plan and COVID-19 protocols.” Heather Leigh But even so, Connell says he takes the city’s message very seriously. “If you’re going to come down to Five Bucks Drinkery you’ve got to follow the city’s ordinance,” he said. “I’ve got the city’s back on this believe it or not. I want to stand with the city, I want to be an ally to the city of St. Petersburg, I don’t wanna be an enemy.” Connell says he’s hired a new security team to help enforce the mask policy plus they will designate a “mask manager” on staff to keep an eye out for folks who don’t have one. They will provide a mask to someone who doesn’t have one, and plan on selling cloth masks for $5 with all proceeds benefiting Big Brothers/Big Sisters. The plan also says customers will ONLY be served if they are seated and there will be no bar service. They will have hand sanitizer throughout the building and temp checks for employees. Connell says these rules are non-negotiable, even for employees who are spotted without a mask. “The majority of the problems that we’ve had in the past was an employee bringing it down or taking it off so the customer could hear them more clearly, it’s a loud bar on a busy night. It’s hard to understand some people sometimes,” he said, adding, “You’ve got to wear your mask because it’s in the interest of public health. If that mask comes off for any reason or if it’s down or it’s not properly worn it’s a zero-tolerance, we’re gonna have to fire you on the spot.” He says they also plan on limiting capacity inside the bar to only the number of actual seats inside. There are signs posted at all entrances alerting people to the new policies. He also says food protocols will change. All forks/knives will be one-time disposable and food will be served in single-use disposable baskets, except salads. Connell says they plan to open later Friday in order to go through training with employees and hopes customers will not only understand but fully comply. “Let’s play by the rules, we can still have a good time. The environment may feel a little bit different than if ever used to but this is just temporary,” he said. “I made a commitment to the city that we’re going to do the best we possibly can and it means whatever we gotta do, we’re gonna do it!” Copyright 2021 Scripps Media, Inc. Don't miss out on the Seminole Buck Mule, a standout drink featuring Elijah Craig and Strawberry that has received positive mentions. The 5 Bucks Chicken Stack is a favorite among patrons, especially when grilled, and pairs well with the fried pickles. For a great quick meal, the hand-breaded chicken tenders are highly praised and perfect for a casual dinner. If you're in the mood for something light, the mahi mahi tacos are a delicious choice that reflect homemade quality. Learn more about Five Bucks Drinkery Five Bucks Drinkery is a lively restaurant located in Pinellas Park, FL, offering a casual dining experience that attracts both locals and visitors. It's known for its friendly atmosphere and reasonably priced menu, making it a perfect spot for a quick bite or a relaxed meal with friends. Ambiance : Friendly and welcoming environment, perfect for casual gatherings and family-friendly fun. Cuisine : Offers a diverse menu featuring salads, tacos, and classic American food, with highlighted favorites like sliders and chicken stack. Highlights : Features a large bar, communal seating, and a sporting atmosphere, making it ideal for dining and drinks. The restaurant's layout includes an inviting porch, a spacious inside bar, and communal tables that foster a sense of community among patrons. It's not just the food that draws people in; the energetic vibe and excellent service create a memorable experience. Whether stopping by for a late-night snack or a full meal, guests can expect generous portions and a variety of options to suit different tastes. The attentive staff ensures that everyone's needs are met, making Five Bucks Drinkery a destination worth visiting. Book it Now Get to Know Us We've Been Around For Awhile! Our second location off of 49th Ave N. and Park Blvd opened its doors on June 15th, of 2023 making this location one year old! Including all of our signature staples from our original location in Downtown St. Pete we offer outdoor patio dining, live entertainment, and you guessed it… our 32 oz. Big a$$ Drinks!I We provide a comfortable setting of old school Midwest bar feel, with a modern custom art-work and bright neon signs you’ll feel right at home. We’ve got ice-cold beer, great service, and a spot for you and your buddies to watch your favorite teams all-year-long look no further! Just because you're out on the town doesn't mean you have to miss the game. TVs are on in the bar area to give you all the latest scores.  On warmer days, take advantage of Five Bucks Drinkery's outdoor seating.  Five Bucks Drinkery caters to all party sizes, both large and small.  Customers here often groove to live music or a DJ.  Enjoy live music with your food and drinks at Five Bucks Drinkery as well.  Be sure to swing by Five Bucks Drinkery for frequent performances from live DJs.  The noise at the restaurant can be positively thunderous, so save intimate conversations for another night. Wear what you like when you dine at Five Bucks Drinkery — the restaurant has a chill vibe just right for casual dining.  You can call it in, then carry it out. At Five Bucks Drinkery, street and lot parking is made simple for diners.  Bikers can store their bikes safely while they enjoy a meal at Five Bucks Drinkery. Dining out doesn t have to be an expensive luxury, and Five Bucks Drinkery serves deliciousness that everyone can afford.  The 21st-century is here at Five Bucks Drinkery. Enjoy our emerging cashless society by paying with any major credit card!  Don't put it off any longer, and give Five Bucks Drinkery a try.  There's no doubt about it.
